title: Northern Advanced Research Training Initiative II (NARTI II)
abstractText:
The Northern Advanced Research Training Initiative is a consortium of 14 Business and Management Schools from Universities in the north of England. Its aim is to bring together research-intensive Schools to provide advanced research training to the region's doctoral students and early career researchers in a way that combines an efficient use of resources and leading-edge practice. By pooling expertise from across the 14 universities, researchers are able to benefit from world-class training irrespective of their institutional home. Specifically, NARTI:

  • organises and facilitates travel to advanced training events in methods and/or subject areas that give focussed and in depth attention to current and emerging trends
  • runs an annual, two day colloquium for doctoral students focused on advanced training
  • provides an arena for these people to network and share research interests, contacts and advice through a dedicated website hosted by Leeds University Business School

The intent is to bring about collaboration between faculty and research students, building tight knit research communities focussed on a specific approach or set of concerns, and bringing about a step change in the quality, vision and expectation of the training being offered that would not be viable for a single institution to deliver.
